title: Detroit Jury Deliberating Over Porch Shooting Of Unarmed Teenager
teaser: Theodore Wafer says he killed 19-year-old Renisha McBride on his front porch last November in self defense.
contentencoded:
Jurors in Detroit are deliberating in the trial of Theodore Wafer, a white Dearborn Heights man who shot and killed an African American teenager on his front porch last November.

Wafer doesn’t dispute that he killed 19-year-old Renisha McBride, after she banged on his porch door at 4:40 in the morning. He says he did so in self-defense, that he was afraid she was trying to break in.

Here & Now’s Robin Young talks to Sarah Cwiek, a reporter with Michigan Radio and the Here & Now Contributor’s Network, about the case and the trial.
